rule: Use Doxygen-style comments for all classes, methods, and functions
suggested_fix: Add /** @brief Description @param x Parameter @return Return value */ comments

rule: Document class member variables with inline comments
suggested_fix: Add comments after member declarations: int count; ///< Number of items

rule: Never use 'using namespace std;' in header files
suggested_fix: Remove 'using namespace std;' from headers and use std:: prefix explicitly

rule: Prefer explicit namespace qualifiers over 'using' directives in implementation files
suggested_fix: Use std::cout instead of 'using namespace std;' to avoid naming conflicts

rule: Use const references for function parameters when passing non-primitive types
suggested_fix: Change 'void func(std::string s)' to 'void func(const std::string& s)'

rule: Mark member functions as const when they don't modify the object
suggested_fix: Add const after method signature: int getValue() const { return value; }

rule: Use PascalCase for class names and camelCase for method names
suggested_fix: Class names: EnergyCalculator, method names: calculatePower(), variables: motorSpeed

rule: Use descriptive names - avoid single letter variables except for loop counters
suggested_fix: Replace 'int t' with 'int temperature' or 'double p' with 'double power'

rule: Always specify access modifiers (public, private, protected) explicitly
suggested_fix: Add public:/private:/protected: sections to all classes

rule: Make data members private and provide getters/setters as needed
suggested_fix: Move public data members to private section and add public accessor methods

rule: No hardcoded passwords, API keys, or secrets
suggested_fix: Move sensitive data to configuration files or environment variables

rule: Prefer smart pointers (unique_ptr, shared_ptr) over raw pointers
suggested_fix: Replace 'int* ptr = new int' with 'auto ptr = std::make_unique<int>()'

rule: Implement Rule of Three/Five for classes managing resources
suggested_fix: If class has destructor, also implement copy constructor, copy assignment, move constructor, move assignment

rule: Use auto for complex type declarations when type is obvious from context
suggested_fix: Replace 'std::vector<int>::iterator it' with 'auto it' when initializing from begin()

rule: Use nullptr instead of NULL or 0 for null pointers
Mark overriding virtual functions with 'override' keyword
suggested_fix: Add 'override' to virtual function declarations: void func() override;

rule: Use member initializer lists instead of assignment in constructors
suggested_fix: Constructor() : member1(value1), member2(value2) { } instead of assigning in body

rule: Use range-based for loops when iterating over containers
suggested_fix: Replace 'for(int i=0; i<vec.size(); i++)' with 'for(const auto& elem : vec)'
